results.title: Fabulous fifties
results.brief_description: A film about teaching people over fifty how to swim. Shows the participants learning to swim and shows how swimming can aid the health of the over fifties.

results.title: Fabrics in motion
results.brief_description: An experimental film in which an attempt is made to focus attention on the work of the textile designer. The film consists of five miniature solo ballets, each being based on new patterns for fabrics sketched by the textile designer. No explanatory commentary on the ballet is provided - the story of each ballet is left to the imagination of the audience.

results.title: Fabrications
results.brief_description: This film explores the work of Australian and European artists (such as Tadek Butlich from Britain and Isobel Foster from Australia) in the field of fabric sculpture, embroidery, and wall hangings. Detailed observation reveals wide variety in the use of textures, colors and fabrics. The film is not narrated; an electronic score complements the images. This film is suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: F.I.D.O. = Fido
results.creator_credit: Steve Sculley and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Told from the point of view of Harry, a black labrador, F.I.D.O. follows the controversial path of the Fairfield Industrial Design Object - appropriately named F.I.D.O. The project materialises itself in real life in the form of a proposed public art structure - a 6 metre high dog with lights and a moving tail. We hear from the artists themselves, outraged residents who feel like they have been left out of the democratic process, and a supportive Darebin Council member. Regardless of the outcome and opinions expressed, two things remain - there are a lot of dogs in the City of Darebin, and the face of Fairfield is changing.

results.title: F.D.R. 1882-1945
results.brief_description: A tribute to Franklin Delano Roosevelt, four times President of the United States, born 1882, died 1945, one of the most famous Americans. Using archival footage, the film gives an interesting insight into modern American history.

results.title: F.A. Cup Final 1967
results.brief_description: A brilliant finale to the 1967 British football season between the two London teams, Tottenham Hotspurs and Chelsea as they battle it out for the FA Cup at Wembley Stadium.

results.title: F.A. Cup Final 1965: soccer honours its greatest star
results.brief_description: A record of the 1965 FA Cup Final between two of England’s most famous soccer clubs, Liverpool and Leeds. Includes some background material on Sir Stanley Matthews, showing him with footballers from overseas who were visiting England to participate in celebrations marking his retirement from football and the Queen presenting the Cup.

results.title: F.A. Cup Final 1962
results.brief_description: Records the 1962 FA Cup Final played at Wembley Stadium between the Tottenham Hotspurs and Burnley. Use of slow motion camera work helps make this an outstanding record of a thrilling final as it follows Burnley’s attempt to stand up to the Spurs team at the peak of their form. The Queen and Prince Phillip were among the thousands of spectators.
